an8.30:3.2: I prefer to gender the term mahapurisa, one of the few contexts where I elect for a gendered translation where BB uses a non-gendered one. Mahapurisa is a culturally potent term, comparable to the English “superman”. In its more worldly senses it is emphatically gendered, and I think it is significant to sustain this connection.
an8.30:12.3: This passage is a good example showing that “therefore” is not suited as translation for the “tena hi” idiom. Despite the instrumental, there’s no logical connection implied, merely a loose transition, for which we use “so” in English.
